title: KRG, Baghdad Strike Another Oil Deal
summary: Erbil and Baghdad say theyve once again cracked the code on resuming Kurdistans long-stalled oil exports  at least on paper. The Kurdistan Regions natural resources ministry announced Wednesday that 23 delegates, including 17 from Iraqs oil ministry, have signed off on a...
fullContent: Erbil and Baghdad say theyve once again cracked the code on resuming Kurdistans long-stalled oil exports  at least on paper. The Kurdistan Regions natural resources ministry announced Wednesday that 23 delegates, including 17 from Iraqs oil ministry, have signed off on a new export protocol. Under the deal, KRG will keep 50,000 barrels per day for domestic use, hand the rest to SOMO, and everyone will smile politely while pretending this time will be different. The hitch? Baghdad still needs to convince Turkey

title: Banks tighten scrutiny on overseas investments amid falling net FDI
summary: Banks are closely watching Indian companies' foreign investments. They are asking more questions about the purpose and success of these ventures. This happens as foreign investment in India has significantly decreased.
fullContent: Banks are closely watching Indian companies' foreign investments. They are asking more questions about the purpose and success of these ventures. This happens as foreign investment in India has significantly decreased. Banks now want detailed information and proof before approving money transfers abroad. This ensures investments are genuine and used correctly, as per Reserve Bank of India guidelines.
